Text: You interrupted Choe's \n ceremony, that means \n death!
Don't look at me!
Well, I'm off to fix \n that monitor.
I don't need your \n excuses, just fix that \n monitor!
Really? They don't \n seem anything alike.
That was probably me \n saying "Echo", "Echo".
We don't have time. \n Just follow my lead!
I was repeating her name \n and praying for her to \n have a safe birth.
M-Me? What can I do?

Guess the students 
 aren't the only ones who 
 believe in wishing for 
 things to happen.
But I can still swear I saw someone \n else at that ceremony...
Alright everyone, pack \n it up and go home!
If you don't want \n something bad to happen, \n help us finish this!

Speaking of monitors, do 
 they ever show anything 
 but election stuff 
 anymore?
Girl Near the Goddess Statue
Echo... Echo... \n E... Cho... E... \n Ah! Now I get it.
What is it Dusty?
I'm no repairwoman.
We have to complete \n the ceremony!
Boy Near the Goddess Statue
Wait... "A Mirror that \n Depicts Figments."
Pandora means the \n monitor! So "revive" \n must mean "fix".
She's not real!? Who's \n going to grant our \n wishes now?

Here I am at the 
 student centre. 
 This place takes 
 me back...
But how can I fix it? \n Maybe if I give it a \n good whack?
I'm not sure what kind \n of wishes you were \n hoping to get granted...
Meow!
That girl's alone, but \n I'll bet the others are \n coming soon.
Okay... No, I don't \n understand... Did I do \n something wrong?
I'll just find a place \n to hide and see how this \n plays out.
A Dead Man's \n Guidance... \n What could that mean?
No, I guess not.
Echo? Newt! \n What's going on?

Echo later told me that the three girls 
 from the ceremony put their dark 
 "extracurricular activities" behind them 
 and returned to their studies.
So this headmaster \n statue is the "Dead \n Man"...
I should check the next \n prophecy...
Huh? Is that a girl \n with long hair?
Anyway, it's time to \n put this secret ritual \n stuff behind us.

I think this goes back 
 to what happened in the 
 student centre all that 
 time ago.
Get off that, you'll \n break it!
Maybe she went home \n after getting spotted by \n the police.
And over time, it \n evolved into the whole \n "Choe" legend.
B-But, before, I heard a \n man's voice in the \n dark...
Please, I don't want to \n die. Take her, it's her \n fault!
Ghost Stories
W-Wait, when was that?
Choe? That must be \n the demon's name!
Someone else must've \n seen what happened and \n started a rumour.
He was chanting \n "Choe", "Choe"!
S-Sorry, \n I didn't mean to-

Who'd have thought all 
 that stuff that happened 
 with Echo would've been 
 distorted like this?
Girl Who Knows About the Ceremony
Boy Who Knows About the Ceremony
O-Okay!
You again! Are you \n following me!?
The Nevi Echo was \n raising in the student \n centre...
You've got everyone \n worried. Stop this stuff \n and go home.

Of course, statues 
 aren't alive! Which 
 would make the dead 
 man the headmaster!
E-Cho. Echo. Yes, me. \n I'm the "demon".
Noooo! \n I don't want to die!

No, no, you've got it 
 backwards. I'm not 
 breaking it, I'm fixing 
 it!

Aww, look at me getting 
 all freaked out over 
 some superstitious 
 nonsense.
Wait! "Choe"... \n "Cho-e"...
Yeah, yeah, tell it to \n the judge! You kids are \n all crazy these days.

Uh-oh, I hope hearing 
 the demon's name didn't 
 put a curse on me or 
 something.
She's so different now \n from the girl she was \n back then.
So I asked Echo \n about it.

Yet here I was getting 
 all freaked out by that 
 superstition. Guess I 
 still need to grow up.
But I've got my \n doubts...
Huh?
The new guy's got a plan \n to bring peace to the \n city.
You don't understand... \n Choe's wrath is \n all-powerful!
Hmm, could that be \n one of the students \n I'm looking into?
Those types that talk \n big are all alike.
We never had any of \n this demon stuff when \n we were students.
But worshipping an empty \n student centre isn't \n going to work.

Remember what happened 
 with Mayor D'nelica, the 
 last guy that made that 
 kind of promise?
Well, at least all of \n that weirdness about \n demons is over.
Yeah you! That's \n vandalism!
It's down the stairs, \n you can't miss it.
But I swear I-... \n Never mind.
Just a minute ago.
Powerful Choe, \n hear our pleas.
Could you take care of \n another monitor while \n you're at it?
It was staring me right \n in the face, thanks \n Dusty!
I told you I'm no \n repair- Ah, alright \n I'll go give it a try.
I tried to give her \n a warning, but she \n ran off.
There you go, thanks \n for taking care of \n that for me.
The monitor's busted! \n This is all your fault!
Girl Near the Ferris Wheel
Just like that one I saw \n climbing the school \n fence after dark...
This has to be the \n "Dark Gathering" in the \n prophecy.
That did it!
Boy Near the Ferris Wheel
I should ask the students about this.
Hey, Kat, how are you \n doing?
Good, but you look \n exhausted, Newt.
Yeah, guess I would.
I've been pulling guard \n duty after classes for \n the past few days.
Teachers have to do \n guard duty? They make \n you work two jobs?
Not usually, but \n lately...
Some of the students are \n gathering after classes \n and acting suspiciously.
One of the girls even \n dropped out of school.
I've been trying to get \n to the bottom of it, but \n well...
Yeah, I guess students \n wouldn't spill the beans \n to a teacher...
Exactly. A teacher is \n probably the last person \n they'd trust.
Hey, I've got an idea! \n Maybe you could ask \n them?
Me?

They'll know you're not 
 a  teacher, you might 
 get something out of 
 them.
I've got a spare uniform \n to help you blend in.
Feels like I've done \n this kind of thing for \n you before.
Back when you and Echo \n were students at the \n academy.
And she was hiding that \n Nevi in the student \n centre.

That was a long time 
 ago, though. Now look at 
 you two, married, with a 
 baby.
Guess in a way the only \n one who hasn't changed \n is me.

Some things are fine 
 just the way they are, 
 right? Here's the 
 uniform.
Ask the Students \n for Information
Newt: \n Ask around to see if you can find something out.
I wonder where those girls are meeting...
Ick, that story freaked me out.
Okay, I'll head over there.
That must be the reporter.
Wow, a secret ritual?
Head Back to Newt
Go to Pandora's Fortunes \n with Newt
Alright, let's head over there.
Newt: \n Heh, this reminds me of the first time we all flew together.
I need to ask the students for information.
I should try to find that reporter.
I need to check around the Ferris Wheel for that reporter.
I should try to find that reporter.
I need to check around the goddess statue for that reporter.
Newt: \n Hey, don't forget me.
No? Okay, I'll keep asking around.
Don't know anything about it? Okay.
Hm?
I need to get back to Newt.
Newt: \n Kat, Pandora's Fortunes is that way.
Guess with classes out, no one's here. I'll check Pleajeune.
Rumours about \n after-class activities? \n Oh yeah...
You must mean that \n meeting the girls are \n having.

They're probably 
 just sitting around 
 chowing on junk food 
 and chatting.
That's what girls do, \n right?
Hmm... A secret \n meeting for girls...
After-class stuff? Yeah, \n come to think of it...

Some creepy girls are 
 getting together after 
 class and doing 
 something.
Probably just chatting \n and stuff.
I'm too busy to be \n bothered with that kind \n of stuff.
A secret meeting \n among girls, huh...
A secret meeting? \n I've got no idea what \n you're talking about...
This girl's eyes look a \n little glazed over...
O-Oh, I just remembered \n something funny. Wanna \n hear it?
A while ago, one of the \n big monitor screens in \n Pleajeune fell...
It landed right on top \n of a girl and killed her \n instantly.
Uh, that's not funny at \n all. She's a bit odd...
They say something \n strange appears in the \n monitors now.

In the middle of the 
 night, they turn to 
 static, and a girl with 
 long hair shows up.
The longer you watch, \n the closer and closer \n she gets, until...
Lalala-I'm not hearing \n the ending. I'll, uh, \n talk to you later!

Can you tell me 
 something about the 
 girls who are meeting up 
 in secret after school?
How should I know what \n they do?
Maybe the school \n reporter knows. He's \n always snooping around.
Just saw him over by the \n goddess statue. You \n should ask him.
Hey, do you know \n anything about the girls \n who meet after school?
Beats me, I don't keep \n track of their comings \n and goings.

If it's about a rumour, 
 you should ask the 
 school reporter. He'd 
 know what's up.
I saw him over by the \n goddess statue if you \n want to check with him.

Can you tell me 
 something about the 
 girls who are meeting up 
 in secret after school?
How should I know what \n they do?
Maybe the school \n reporter knows. He's \n always snooping around.
Just saw him over by the \n Ferris Wheel. You should \n ask him.
Hey, do you know \n anything about the girls \n who meet after school?
Beats me, I don't keep \n track of their comings \n and goings.

If it's about a rumour, 
 you should ask the 
 school reporter. He'd 
 know what's up.
I saw him over by the \n Ferris Wheel if you want \n to ask him.
Are you the school \n reporter? I've got \n a question for you...

You're trying to find 
 out about those girls 
 and what they're doing 
 after school too?
You came to the right \n place, no one but them \n knows more than me.
Really? Great! What can \n you tell me?
They're demon \n worshippers!
They're using forbidden \n knowledge to conduct \n secret rituals...

Those rituals are for 
 one demon in particular, 
 but it's certain death 
 to say its name...
It starts with "Cho", \n but that's all I can \n say.
Cho...?
A group of girls \n worshipping a demon \n after school?

This sounds like a job 
 for Aki, if anyone knows 
 about secret stuff, 
 it's her!
Meow!
I'll give Newt an update \n and then suggest we head \n over to Aki's place.
A secret ritual? \n A demon?
And the demon's name \n starts with "Cho".
We need to put a stop to \n this right now.
But how? I hardly think \n a stern talking to is \n going to help.
How about we ask Aki? \n She might have an idea \n for us.
Good idea! Let's drop by \n Pandora's Fortunes then.
Welcome to Pandora's \n Fortunes. I knew you \n were coming.
You're seeking knowledge \n of the girls and their \n secret ritual?

Pandora has already 
 prepared a prophecy you 
 can use to find out what 
 you need to know.
That's what I like about \n fortune tellers, always \n prepared!
Good, because the bill \n has also been prepared.
That's kind of steep on \n a new teacher's salary. \n Could I get a receipt?
Of course, I'll give it \n to you on the way out.

Let's see... "A Head on 
 Fire", "Reviving a 
 Mirror that Depicts 
 Figments"...
A Dead Man's \n Guidance, "A Dark \n Gathering"...

Aki's not the only 
 fortune teller... I knew 
 Pandora's prophecies 
 wouldn't make any sense.

Alright, let's tackle 
 them one at a time. 
 First up, "A Head on 
 Fire."
I hope that's not a \n literal prophecy!

Kat, I'm sorry to duck 
 out on you, but can you 
 take care of this for 
 me?
If the students see \n you with me, they'll \n be on their guard...
I'll do my own \n digging around...
And I've got to check on \n whether the school will \n honour this receipt.
Okay, I'll handle this. \n See you later!
Guess Newt has to watch \n his budget now that he's \n got a family...
Find "A Head on Fire"
I guess I should look for a fire.
I think there was fire near Pandora's Fortunes.
I think I saw it over that way.
Could this be what that prophecy was about?
Hmm, nothing out of the ordinary.
Huh? This monitor seems broken. Wait... Oh no!
Mysterious Voice: \n What are you doing!?
AAH!
Revive the Mirror that \n Depicts Figments
I hope this doesn't get me haunted...
I should just get this over with.
That must be it.
That did the trick.
Police Officer: \n You there! What are you doing?
Who me?
Head to Arquebus Academy
I'll go check out the school.
I need to find that "head on fire".
Old Man: \n Hey, aren't you gonna fix that monitor?
I should head down the stairs and look for that monitor.
I need to fix that monitor.
A head on fire... What could that be?
I need to go fix that monitor.
Got it!
I need to go fix that monitor.
I've got to get over to Arquebus Academy.
Well, I'm at the school, but no one's here.
Wait! Is that...
Ah...
Guess I should go where he's pointing.
Heed the Dead Man's \n Guidance
Well, I'm up here... Hm?
That's that weird girl from before. I should follow her.
Follow the Schoolgirl
I'll wait there.

Here they come...
Schoolgirl: \n Sorry I'm late!

Hold it!

Wh-What!?

I need to go where that statue is telling me.
Alert Level
She'll see me!
Phew, safe.

She spotted me!
I lost her!
I'm gonna lose her.
She seems awfully nervous.
Where's she going?
What are they trying to do with that ritual, anyway?
Empty schools sure are creepy.
The last prophecy was about a dark gathering...
I should wait for the other girls to show up.
Choel!
Luecho!
